The bird is an Egret, a type of wading bird in the heron family. Egrets have long, slender necks and long legs. They are typically white or gray in color and have long, pointed bills. Egrets are typically found near water and feed on fish, frogs, and other aquatic animals.
The bird is a Great Egret (Ardea alba). It is a large white heron with long legs and a long neck. It is found in wetlands and other shallow water habitats.
